title: Liam Payne and Cheryl split when he released For You with Rita Ora
text:
Liam Payne revealed his split from Cheryl came around the time he released his collaboration with Rita Ora (Picture: Rex)

Liam Payne revealed he and Cheryl split months before they confirmed the break-up to the public, around the time he released his hit collaboration For You, with Rita Ora.

Although Liam and Cheryl – who share two-year-old baby son Bear – announced their split in July 2018, the former One Direction star admitted that their break up happened much earlier in the year.

He confessed to Jessie Ware on her Table Manners podcast: ‘We broke up around For You, actually, which is quite interesting.’

Fans will know Liam and Rita’s collaboration was released in January 2018, and was closely followed by a series of steamy live performances.

The song was on the soundtrack for Fifty Shades Freed, and their sexy performances together were said to be the catalyst for his break up from Cheryl.

Cheryl’s people denied the claims the couple split up in January rather than July 2018, telling the MailOnline: ‘This is a nonsense story. Liam doesn’t say on the podcast that they split up in January or at the time of release of With You.

‘That is The Sun’s wrong interpretation of his quote. The couple 100 per cent split in July 2018 as was well documented. This is just an agenda driven story once again.’

The couple had put on a united front at February 2018’s Brit Awards red carpet, but announced they were parting ways just five months later.

Liam revealed he had a great time working on the song with Rita, explaining: ‘It was great, I really enjoyed making it.

‘It was a lot of fun, she’s great to work with as well. I don’t know anyone who works harder, to be honest with you. She’s f**king crazy.’

Liam also added that he and Cheryl struggled to go out in public together during their relationship, admitting: ‘I think we kind of rubbed off on each other a little bit in that way.

Liam is now dating model Maya Henry (Picture: Splash News)

‘In a bad way, actually. And it was neither of our faults because we have both been through so many circumstances but all of that stuff puts so much pressure on a relationship.

‘Say going out for a dinner or whatever it is, whereas now my whole new thing is that I don’t give a s**t, it’s not worth sacrificing my happiness and it’s been far too long of different relationships that that’s come between me [and them].

‘But that’s a lot of pressure on whoever you’re with, and I mean Cheryl’s had that pressure for life. So for her, if you were going out somewhere, it would take so long to get out of the door because you’re just so worried about what that shot’s going to look lie.

‘Whereas now I’m just like “f**k it”, just go out and have some fun.’
